dialogues.text: I can assure you that security on the set will be at an all time high. Again, the deaths are sheer tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd hate to see the production shut down. (laughs) I myself am a big STAB fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? (smiles) Have you ever thought about acting? You've got just the right face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am kind of dedicated to my job. Although I do enjoy taking acting classes on my weekends. I grew up around these studios anyway. I know my way around. My Uncle was a screenwriter for PARAMOUNT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, what was his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Kincaid can finish, Gale buts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me Detective, I think we have some business to attend to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flabbergasted) GALE WEATHERS?! What are you doing here? No press on the set! (to security) No press, no press on set! Get that woman out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching) Yes, Mr. Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mr. Milton, Miss Weathers is with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton nods his head, flags down the guard. He walks away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, I guess I'll be leaving then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on! Why the hostility?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Lois Lane, I love your show and  all but last month I happened to catch  your little segment on me and how my wife  left me because I'm a sex addict who  enjoys screwing fifteen year old girls.  It was a real eye opener my lawyers are  still thinking about bringing to your  superior's attentions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shit-eating smile on her face) They're the ones who approved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton storms off camera, Buddy following close behind. G Kincaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright Kincaid, no where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go to the police station and do my job, and you go back to being Gale Weathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I thought you wanted me to stick around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Miss Weathers, if there's a problem,  give me a call. Here's my card. I'm always there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid hands Gale his card, begins to walk out of the bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Can I even get a ride home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIDNEY PRESCOTT, the stoic, survivor. Now 24, she lies pe black lab PETE curled up in a ball at her feet. A noise s awake. It sets off the bed barking hysterically at --

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY --
dialogues.text: --awakens. She squints her eyes to try and make out what conniptions over. Then she sees, and her face loses any t MAUREEN PRESCOTT'S GHOSTLY WRAITH is pressed up against t wearing a tattered, blood soaked night shift.  Her voice are moving as if trying torelay a message to Sidney. Sid' She slidesoff her bed, makes her way towards the window w MAUREEN slides down the glass, as if being pulled by some window sill. Something we don't see . . . yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left behind in her wake are five bloody streaks running d streaks begin to bleed, as if each wounds themselves. The the glass. Sidneyreaches out to touch them when suddenly THE GHOST springs up behind the window, shatters the glas SIDNEY screams -- AWAKENING IN BED FROM HER NIGHTMARE. Her dog's barking wildly. THE WINDOW is fine.  SID crawls out of bed, disappearing out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid's washing up at the sink. She wipes the tears from he the running water, looks up into the mirror. Her demeanor ware and tear of all that's happened to her in her past.  CLOSE on SIDNEY'S WRISTS.  Two ugly scars run up Sid's wr a war waged between her own personal demons if you wish. Attempts former engraved on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid's house is deep within the Napa Valley. Secluded amon and orchards that are now covered by thedarkness of night ominously in the sky above. A light burns from within the two story farmhouse. A phon in pre-lap as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid sits in a cluttered office. On the wall hangs a poste (her play from SCREAM 2) and a poster proclaiming WOMEN'S CALIFORNIA WOMEN'S CRISIS center written beneath that. A THREE-RING BINDER with a cover boasting CALIFORNIA WOME thrown open.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHONE--
dialogues.text: SID PUTS ON A HEADSET, dials a number. RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into headset) This is Laura in Monterey reporting in for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright Laura I'll patch you right  in to a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A click. A woman's voice comes on the other line. It soun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, hi I'm Laura, I'm a trained counselor. How can I help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura I think I just killed somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh I'm sure. I've killed someone! OH MY GOD I'VE ACTUALLY KILLED SOMEONE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then the people you need to call are the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I need to call you. Just you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to know how you can help, Sidney? (a beat, Sid goes blank) Are you listening to me, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mother, Sidney, now be a good  girl and turn on the news. DO IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid reaches for the remote control, flips on a small TV l office.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV --
dialogues.text: A REPORTER stands with the HOLLYWOOD SIGN in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mutilated bodies were discovered late  last night by the L.A.P.D, prominent actor  Ben Damon was slated for a role in the  upcoming STAB 3: RETURN TO WOODSBORO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney shuts off the TV as a familiar voice cuts through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's over Sidney? Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to finish what I started. I want to finish the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sick fuck I'm tracing this call as we speak! The police are gonna nail your ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs coldly) Let them try. You'll never find me. I've already gotten away with murder before. For instance, Maureen Prescott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears welling) No. You didn't kill my mother. Billy Loomis and Stu Macher did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh. So you think Sidney. So you think. It's all been building up to this Sid. Every STAB. Every SCREAM. Every ounce of blood that's been spilled has all been leading up to this moment. WELCOME TOTHE FINAL ACT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final act? Well let's play asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We play in my court this time. Come to Hollywood. STAB 3's going to cutting  corners cast-wise.  And I've got my eyes set  on a technical advisor named Dewey Rielly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer laughs coldly. Sidney wanes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) If you lay a hand on him I'll fucking kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. A spirited one. I'll be seeing you real soon Sidney. Real soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click. The killer hangs up. Sid's left trembling. She rip the phone, reaches into her desk for a loaded.38 special. peers out her office window. SIDNEY'S P.O.V. - THE DARK, OMINOUS NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah Darling drives through the main gates in her porshe

dialogues.text: Sarah parks outside the production offices, gets out of h KILLER'S P.O.V - watching from the rooftop, Sarah approac offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah steps into the office. It's desolate. Silent. All o promotional items (standees, posters, banners) for STABS big cardboard GHOST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAB 3. Oh God I've gotta get myself  a better agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah walks down a hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Anybody home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah passes Roman Bridger's office. It's half-open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doubt that. (door slams shut O.S.) Anyone here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah continues further down the hall when suddenly -- TYSON comes reeling out of a doorway, a huge knife juttin trickling down his mouth. Sarah lets out a bloodcurdling breaks into hysterics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan! My man does great work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, a bearded, middle aged make-up effects guy steps ou him a high-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you very much! Tyson go to hell! What the hell are you doing here? Where's Roman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman and everybody else went home for  the night. I'm here for a make-up test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make-up. You need it. (a beat) Hey, Roman isn't here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. He called my roommate and told her  he had some important things he wanted to  go over with me in his office tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jokingly) Yeah I bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan pantomimes the "blow job" gesture. Tyson laughs, sla five. Sarah makes a disgusted face as the two men leave t sighs, ducks into Roman's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman's office is a clutter of old movie memorabilia. Sar Roman's desk, admires his old TRANSFORMER toys and two br AWARDS. Sarah examines the award.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading inscription) For the honorary field of directing and  cinematography in music videos. How to the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings scaring the shit out of Sarah. She drops to smash against the edge of the desk, snapping the head hesitates, answers the call, putting it on speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. (into phone) Hello? Director's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, it's Roman, I'm sorry I'm running  late, I'm still on the 405, I'm about 10  minutes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's no problem, I'm just... looking at  your   music video awards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah tries fixing the award with some scotch tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, since I got you on the phone,  let's talk about your character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What character?  I'm Candy, the chick who  gets killed second.  I'm only in two scenes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not happy with your part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not happy that I'm 35 playing a 21 year old.  I'm not happy that I have to die naked!  And I'm  not happy that my character is too stupid not to  have a gun in the house after her boyfriend's been  cut into McNuggets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um hmm...  umhmm great, so let's run the  lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 22, Candy's big moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 22..  Ring ring.  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Candy.  Hang on, let me get some  clothes. See!  I don't' understand why I have  to start the scene in the shower!  The whole  shower things been done, 'Vertigo' hello!  And I  mean, my boyfriend just died, why am I showering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just read the scene?  Candy, is  that like candy cane or candy apple?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.  Come on, who is this?  I think you have  the wrong number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know my favorite name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hanging up right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman that's not the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is in my script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has there been another goddamn rewrite?    How  the fuck are we supposed to learn our  lines when there's a new script every 15 minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just a new script, it's a new movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause, then a familiar dark natured noise enters our ea sinister voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called, Sarah gets sliced like a  fucking pig. Still in character, Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah tosses down the phone, bolts out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah stops in her tracks. Through the smoked glass of th a shape approaching. She screams, spins around, runs for

dialogues.text: Sarah locks the door, backs up right into --

dialogues.speaker: AN ARMY OF GHOSTS
dialogues.text: AT LEAST THIRTY GHOST COSTUMES dangle from hooks on costu catches her breath, dives into one of the racks.  She pul starts to dial.

dialogues.text: A SECURITY GUARD opens the front door, pokes his head int

dialogues.text: Mr. Bridger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. The guard nods, backs out of the offices, lock and the killer inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah's waiting on eggs as a digitized pre-programmed com Sunrise Studios drags out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah momentarily glances behind her, just noticing, a pa boots stepping off the costume rack. Before Sarah has a c ghost jumps down and shoves the rack hard sending a screa next room. She goes flying out, slamming into a metal tab weapons.

dialogues.speaker: THE GHOST --
dialogues.text: Stomps into the second prop room, knife raised. Sarah lea chuck the prop knives at her attacker, screaming furiousl THE PROP knives, hit the ghost, and bend as they bounce o the floor. The killer shakes his head angrily, stalks tow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) No! No! Noooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ghost drives his knife into Sarah's chest, once, twic final killing blow to her Adam's apple. She staggers forw her by her long buxom hair, and hucks her into a glass do THE DOOR EXPLODES, SARAH'S BODY falling through, shards o her back. THE KILLER, stands in the shattered doorway, bloody knife resonates in the b.g. The killer wipes his knife clean, r A NICE PSYCHO-ESQUE close up of the dead Sarah's eye as B pupil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The highway is desolate. It's late. Sidney speeds into fr CIVIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney's tapping her thumbs nervously against the steerin song filters off the radio. The only light comes from the green digital clock/radio read-out. Sidney increases spee

dialogues.text: Sid passes up a road sign indicating LOS ANGELES - 64 MIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lot Is crawling with police vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid and Gale stare at Sarah Darling's corpse as it's black rubber body bag and carried off by forensic technic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's STAB 3, Miss Weathers. It looks like we're going to be getting a warrant to speak with Miss Prescott anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Sarah Darling. (a beat) I interviewed her too. God, it's happening again isn't it Detective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes well we have a suspect, so don't get that worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale's eyes light up. She grabs Kincaid's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not at liberty to tell you that Miss Weathers. You're no longer working with the L.A.P.D. I don't even know why you're standing in here right now. By all means I should have you thrown out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you won't. You're a good man detective. We think alike. I know you need my help. And I know you know I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my fifteen years as a homicide detective I've never met a single soul as pushy and brazen as you are Miss Weathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, call me Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal, but I'm still Detective Kincaid,ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale smiles. DETECTIVE TOM WALLACE, Kincaid's cohort and late thirties. Family man. Wallaceenters frame with a fol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, Bridger's in custody. We traced his phone records. He's the last person to speak to Sarah Darling before she died. Or at least call her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, Roman's your suspect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Diane Sawyer, this here is classified  information. Why don't you go investigate  the bad meat at the A.P. This is police work, not Pulitzer material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, cool it Wallace. She's working with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cocky) Well then. Looks like I'll go dust for finger prints with Barbara Walters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace arrogantly walks off camera. Gale looks at Kincai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frazzled Roman is seated at a long conference table whi Kincaid grill him with questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bridger, you didn't tell us you spoke with Sarah Darling before she died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard said she was there for a meeting with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talked to her roommate, too.  Says you called Sarah and told her to come down to the studio.  Roommate  answered the phone, says it was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute!  I never called her! I never told  her to go   anywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roommate says she knows your voice, Mr. Bridger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she wasn't speaking with me!  Look, I did  not call   Sarah Darling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah Darling said you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is trying to ruin my movie.   Someone wants to kill   my movie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look at it this way, if anything this'll  be something interesting to put on the  director's commentary for when the film hits DVD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry laugh) Ha! Too late, studio's shutting down production. Called my film a risk! Do you believe this shit? They're actually shelving my film because there's  been one ensie little murder. God, three people died  during the filming of The Exorcist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I doubt they were stabbed to death and I  strongly doubt the killer of them left messages  on the scene for the police to find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera pans through a two-way mirror into . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALE AND DEWEY stand, gazing through the two-way mirror. They watch nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found another note?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Another News clipping. Another one   about Sid's mom. Dewey, whether we like it  or  not it looks like we're going to have to  go  back into our past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean OUR past as in Me and Sid. This has nothing to do with you Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has everything to do with me Dewey. I was the one who brought the nation's   attention to this shit anyway. I'll be   damned if I'm gonna sit around and pass   on the buck again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really mean it this time Gale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Look, let's get something straight   Dewey, I got into this shit cause the police   came looking for ME. Not cause I'm out to   make the SUNRISE STUDIOS SLASHINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would the police come to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, I am the author of the definitive book on  the Woodsboro murders.! (a beat) What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you'd never leave Woodsboro, 'The only  place that's real!'  But now you're here.   Not with me.  Dewey, I took care of you.  I waited  until you were well.  I couldn't stay there, I mean,  it's like dog years, one year in Woodsboro is  like seven everywhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's off to London for a week?  New York for a  month? L.A Forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was fucking '60 Minutes II'!  I couldn't say no!  I could've been the next Diane Sawyer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with just being Gale Weathers?   I liked her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't work Dewey.  We tried,  we're different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to say that was our strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey, you're not just here because of   that second rate K-Mart, straight-to-video  version of me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brace yourself, Gale, all of this is actually not  About you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of what Dewey?  You do know something,  don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two months ago, the Woodsboro police got a call from a woman who said she was with 'Stab 3'.  She wanted to  see the file on Sid, for research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys said no.  She wouldn't give her name.   A month later, the station gets broken into,  the file room ransacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone stole Sid's file?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already removed it.  I think someone on the  film was trying to find Sid, and that's the only  reason I came here. To make do a little  private investigating of my own and make sure no  one here was planning anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whips out cellular) I'm sorry, this is too good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part of 'Off the record' don't you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Sorry. (a beat) Do you think he did it? (RE: ROMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his beeper goes off) I've got my suspicions but still,  nothing  you say can ever make me take  my eyes off one person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Dewey doesn't answer. Again, he's staring daggers thr years of bottled up resentment is finally surfacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer needs me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer?! Wait, where are you going off to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey races out the room. Gale pauses, stares at the inte has reduced Roman to tears. It's pathetic. Gale bolts aft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind rushes past the camera. A huge panoramic view of hangs in the sky. A coyote howls in the near distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nice low ranch tucked away in the valley. Dewey rolls u in his truck. Gale follows behind in her VW JETTA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing Gale) Stop following me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I happen to work for the police god dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither are you, Magnum P.I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale, your engine's still running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey shakes his head in disgust, disappears into the hou shut off her car. From out of the bushes lunges -- TOM PRINZE, loaded off his ass, still holding a half-fill WALKER BLACK LABEL SCOTCH in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale Weathers. What a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

But, here's the critical thing.  If you  find yourself dealing with an unexpected backstory,  and a preponderance of exposition,  then the sequel  rules do not apply.  Because you are not dealing  with a sequel, you are dealing with the concluding  chapter of a trilogy.

It's a rarity in the horror field,  but it does exist, and it's a force to be reckoned  with, because true trilogies are all about going back  to the beginning and discovering something that wasn't  true from the get go.  'Godfather', 'Jedi', all revealed  something that we thought was true, that wasn't true.   S if it is a trilogy you are dealing with, here are some  super trilogy rules.   One, you got a killer who's gonna super human.  Stabbing him won't work, shooting him  won't work, basically in the third one, you gotta  cryogenically freeze his head, decapitate him, or blow hi up.   Number two; anyone including the main character can die.  This means you, Sid.  I'm sorry, it's the final  chapter.  It can be fuckin  'Reservoir Dogs' by the  time this thing is through.  Number three; the past  will come back to bite you in the ass!  Whatever you  think you know about the past, forget it.  The past is  not at rest, any sins you think were committed in  the past are about to break out and destroy you. NUMBER  FOUR,Never, ever under any circumstances go running off  by yourself, cause if Friday the 13th has taught us  anything, it's that the next time we're gonna see you,  you're gonna have a fence post jutting out from your  back. So in closing, let me say good luck, God Speed,  and for some of you, I'll see you soon, cause the rules  say, some of you ain't gonna make it.  I didn't, not  if you're watching this tape.

Bye.

dialogues.text: I remember her!  She was a bit player in a couple  of my movies. A nobody! So what does it matter?

dialogues.text: What the hell are you guys getting at?  I make horror  films, that's what I do.  The Studio came to me  with 'Stab'.  They came to me, check it out.

dialogues.text: But you know who she was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well how would you like his rotten carcass dug up and drug all over National TV? Why don't you start talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was in the 70's, everything was different.   I was well known for my parties, Rina knew what they were It was for girls like her to meet men, men who could get  them parts, if they made the right impression.  Nothing  happened to her that she didn't invite, in one way or  another, no matter what she said afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying she was-

dialogues.text: I'm saying things got out of hand.  Maybe they  did take advantage of her!.  Maybe the sad truth  is, this is not the city for innocence.  No charges  were brought.  And the bottom line is, Rina Reynolds  wouldn't play by the rules.  You wanna get ahead in  Hollywood, you gotta play the game, or go home.

dialogues.text: Kincaid stands at his desk trying to put the pieces of th Sidney's seated beside him, staring at a stack of books o SELLING YOUR WORK IN HOLLYWOOD'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghosts are tough,  you can't shoot ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't arrest ghosts.  But the best way to stop  being haunted is to be with people.  You're here,  you're not hiding, you've done the right thing,  Miss Prescott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.text: What did you know about your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to think I had the perfect mom, perfect  family.  Till I found out I was wrong.  She had a  secret life, and I tried to understand that, and  soon as I thought I had, more secrets.  I don't'  know who my mom was. (a beat) Sometimes I feel like I'm just learning about my  mother for the first time. You know, with TV and  those movies and what not. God sometimes I feel  like I'm just learning about myself for the first  time. Like I'm watching my life instead of living in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat) Here's the deal, I'm off to search the soundstage.  That's good news.
